titleStmt.title: W. S. Bailey to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2049

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: S. P. Higens has resigned his office as justice of the peace in and for Lincoln County he lived in the Crab Orchard precinct.

The people of that precinct have recommended -- to me Archabald Cussan as a suitable person to fill the vacancy of said office and requested me to advise you of their selection; if you shall so think I trust you will commission Mr A Cussan at your earliest conveinence as the Crab orchard people say they are much in need of a justice of the peace

I am &c W. S. Bailey County Judge
&c

Lincoln Co
Justice Peace
Resignation & appointment
14th Mch/65
